name: Uh-Huh Baby Yeah!- Trash Talk
description:
Louder, harder and much more angst-ridden Uh-Huh Baby Yeah returns with a new EP, 'Trash Talk.' The band has been through a lot since their previous release, Till Death Do Us Party, and it shows. While all your other favorite bands lost their piss and vinegar and watered themselves down, this record is designed to rouse your inner fury- and still have fun while doing it. Features the singles 'Dead Friends' and 'Dances With Wolves.'

This release is a joint effort between Little Heart Records and Streaker Records.

name: audiostrobelight- What You're Running From
description:
The Little Heart Records debut from the Virginia quintet arrives packed to the brim with infectious pop melodies. Full of the Summer Anthems you need, the new EP was produced by Will Pugh of Cartel.

Contains the single California Gold Rush.

name: The Lips- Album Numero Dos
description:
Picking up where the previous album left off (self-titled, don't go looking for "Album Numero Uno") The Lips return with 12 new songs and their unique blend of indie garage rock. 

Includes the single "Useless" and "My Name Is Suicide."

name: On My Honor- I Never Deserve The Things I Need
description:
Full length outing from the Knoxville quintet features 10 new songs and a reworking of the fan favorite Indrid Cold.

Vinyl 12" edition is limited to 200 yellow pieces.
(Purple Marble edition is limited to 100 pieces and only available from the band directly).

name: Fast Friends- You and Yours
description:
Get ready for the Little Heart Records debut of Fast Friends (ex-Alcohawk, Reading Group, From The Ground Up, Morning Belle)! Containing 6 catchy tracks with melodic hooks and infectious sounds this release comes with our highest recommendation. For fans of bands like Saves The Day, Brand New and Motion City Soundtrack. 

This release is available in two versions. The standard version (artwork shown) will be the version most copies will be and the only version to stay in print. The limited edition version (not shown) will be a limited run of only 50 copies on a first come/first serve basis. They are hand silk screened by the band (as a nod to their DIY roots and their earlier self done releases) and glow in the dark.

name: Youth at Heart- Make It Home
description: Catchy lyrics and sly hooks headline this 8 song extended EP from the Louisville quartet.

name: Running On E- Late Nights And Long Drives
description: This catchy 5 song Little Heart Records Group debut EP from the Ashville, NC-based pop-punk outfit features the single 'Where's My Money, John?'

name: On My Honor/A Brighter Life- Split
description: In the wee hours of the morning, Puckett took a frantic call. "Puckett, we need to talk to you." "But, On My Honor, it's 3 in the morning? What's wrong?" "Nothing is wrong. We just may have written the greatest songs of our lives." "Okay, let's call some friends. It's time for a split. Now I'm going back to bed." On My Honor (Side A) 1. Indrid Cold 2. Waterways A Brighter Life (Side B) 3. Monumental 4. I'm Not Fine SAVE MONEY! Buy the bundle and get both the UK and US versions by choosing it from the drop down. UK version features B-Side tracks by Above The Underground. For more info, click here.

name: On My Honor/Above The Underground- Split
description: New On My Honor means new bangers. Bangers I tell you. Also features tracks from their European friends, Above The Underground. I would call their tracks bangers too, but doesn't that mean sausage where they come from? Or is that just Ireland? Should probably research these things before I type them... On My Honor (Side A) 1. Indrid Cold 2. Waterways Above The Underground (Side B) 3. Not Home 4. I Was Never Lost SAVE MONEY! Buy the bundle and get both the UK and US versions by choosing it from the drop down. US version features B-Side tracks by A Brighter Life. For more info, click here.

name: Mercy Academy- Hearing
description: Mercy Academy returns with a daring follow-up to their debut album Tales. Hearing represents reinvigorated song writing representing their tweaked line up and clearer direction. These 12 tracks run the gamut of Indie Rock, Folk and Alt Country to present a whole new sound. If you liked Tales, you will love Hearing. If you loved Tales, prepare to find a thesaurus, because you are going to need to find a new word to express yourself.

name: Common Collective- False
description:
The follow up to their 2012 EP T.R.U.T.H. features a reorganized line-up and bold new approach from the hip-hop/funk/rock fusion act.

Translation: throw out your preconceived notions. This is a new Common Collective.

name: Catfight- Catfight
description: Dirty girl rock from the Louisville 4-piece Catfight includes 5 songs. You should buy it. Otherwise, they may beat you up. They're tough.

name: To Die Alone- Departures
description: Taking cues from influences like Touche Amore, La Dispute and Being As An Ocean results in 5 tracks from this young group of upstarts.

name: Think Harder- Timelines and Transitions
description: From Think Harder and Little Heart Records group comes the 5 song EP Timelines and Transitions. Catchy hooks and tons of gang vocals (like the pop punk kids love) collide on these tracks featuring the single Who I Am.

name: Begging Victoria- Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner
description: No actually meals are served with this 5-song EP.

name: Ship Me Overseas- Summer Legs
description: Terry Connell (Vessels, California) teams with Chris LaBarge and Eric Murtagh (also of Vessels) to create this 7-song EP. Emo-Punk in the classic late 90s sense, this collection is for fans of Hot Water Music.

name: On My Honor- Nature and Nurture (Limited Edition 12" Vinyl)
description:
Limited to 300 copies! 
(100 Transparent Gold/200 Transparent Green)

Features all of the songs from the CD and digital versions, plus 3 new acoustic recordings! 

Use the drop down to select color, or get the discounted set!

name: Aesthetics Versus Architecture- Deadbeat
description:
New 5 song EP from Aesthetics Versus Architecture. It's heavy. There's an opera singer. Couple of guest vocals. Yup. You should buy it. 

1. Cowboy Killer
2. Dustmouth
3. Snow
4. Youngblood
5. The Builder and The Arsonist

name: Allister- You Still Can't Do That on Vinyl
description:
ALLISTER IS BACK! Their new album Countdown to Nowhere hit iTunes back in October, but their first new physical US release since their return from hiatus is here and Little Heart Records has it! 

This 7" serves as a sequel of sorts to their original 7" release. The four song collection is the only place you can get the new track 'Swimming Up Stream' in the US. 

This print run is limited to 500 copies on green vinyl. 

Tracklist:
A 1) Free
A 2) Swimming Up Stream
B 1) All We Needed
B 2) Failure

name: Panic Manor- State Lines Define
description: Georgia produced 3 things we really liked. Peaches, The Super-Station and Panic Manor.

name: My Mind's The Weapon... A Tribute to The Movielife
description:
A collection of Little Heart Records' acts and friends pay tribute to one of the label's biggest influences- 16 bands covering 19 classics from The Movielife. Includes the tour favorite covers from A Loss For Words (Face or Kneecaps) and Such Gold (10 Second too Late) and the final recording from Museums (If Only Duct Tape Could Fix Everything). Also making appearances are California, Late Nite Wars, The Stereo State, The Kids United and Last Minute Letter. Full track list below:

Holly Hox and the Forget Me Nots- Taking It Out and Chopping It Up 
Such Gold- I Hope You Die Soon/10 Seconds too Late 
A Loss For Words- Face or Kneecaps 
Nowhere Fast- Hey 
California- Walking on Glass 
Last Minute Letter- Jamestown 
Jeff Boyd- Kelly Song 
Late Nite Wars- You and Me Vs. Them 
The Stereo State- Single White Female 
The Kids United- Once in a Row 
Dylan Massucco- Operate 
Last Minute Letter- Sailor Tattoos 
All Star Me- Up to Me 
Project: Icarus- This Time Next Year 
Museums- If Only Duct Tape Could Fix Everything 
Ehren Smith- Keep Never Changing 
Nowhere Fast- Ship to Shore  
Sangrea Sunrise- Maybe It's Nothing

name: Cosmonauts- Daniel's Letter
description: Cosmonauts are one of our favorite bands, and we are honored to offer this limited edition vinyl of their first formal release: Daniel's Letter. These songs serve as a follow up to their initial offering "The Disfiguration of Emily Malone"- still available at http://www.cosmonautsmusic.com/. Limited to 500 pieces, the record is available in 3 colors. 200 pieces will be pressed on white vinyl. 200 pieces will be pressed on transparent blue vinyl. 100 pieces will be pressed on black vinyl.

name: Late Ones- ...Like The Day After a Heavy Rain
description:
After several months of laying low, Louisville's Late Ones has emerged with their full length release "...Like The Day After a Heavy Rain." Twelve new songs of pop-punk and introspective melody (but don't worry, they still wrote a couple songs about heartbreak). This follow up to 2011's "nailbiter" 7" proves that while Late Ones will never get tired of playing the music the grew up and continue to love, they will learn how to bend the rules of pop punk into something of their own - turn the volume up. 

For fans of Saves the Day, Lifetime, Shook Ones, The Movielife or Title Fight.

name: The Lips- The Lips
description: Oakland, New Jersey Garage/Surf/Indie act The Lips presents their 12 song debut with enough raw energy to power the city for weeks.   Features the single "Bleach."

name: Mercy Academy- Tales
description: Borrowing broad strokes from folk and indie rock, the ten song debut from Mercy Academy features the talents of Christofer Lincoln, Lorna-Mae, Phil Najjar, John Sloan and Brian Lilienthal.

name: Common Collective- t.r.u.t.h.
description: This six song collection contains the fan favorite "Starfighter."

name: Receivers- Haunts (Limited Pressing)
description: Originally conceived as a a digital EP, due to overwhelming demand, we've decided to make a single limited edition pressing of the first "full band" release from Receivers. This EP, picking up where Tyler Ochs left off on the acoustic 'Two Years,' brings in bandmates Ryan Goff and Michael Mruk for a 5 song collection reminiscent of the old days of Brand New.

name: Rock N Roll Television- Self Titled
description: The Little Heart Records debut of Rock N Roll Television. Ten incredibly catchy songs from The Great White North. For fans of Mr T Experience, The Queers, and The Riverdales.

name: Jacobs Ladder- Ring Ring (7" Single)
description: Hear JACOBS LADDER for the first time on vinyl. This pressing is limited to 500 copies (250 in orange/250 in yellow). JACOBS LADDER recorded their new Vinyl/Single "Ring Ring" this fall. Three tracks they recorded w/Carlos de la Garza and one track with Cyrus Bolooki of New Found Glory. Guest keys we're performed by Ikey Owens of The Mars Volta and guest vocals by Ras Emmanuel. "RING RING" SINGLE RELEASE TRACK LISTING 1) Ring Ring Featuring Ras Emmanuel 2) The Silence (Keys Ikey Owens) 3) Lighthouse (Keys by Cyrus Bolooki) 4) The Life (Keys by Ikey Owns) (Note: While the set has not been discounted, realize shipping will be cheaper because the ship charge will be the same.)

name: Your Favorite Hero- Killer on the Lower East Side
description: Little Heart Records' 10 song reissue of the band's 2011 independent release. Features the fan favorite "Baloons."

name: Late Ones- nailbiter
description:
The heirs to the mid-90s pop punk/melodic hardcore sound have arrived with this infectiously catchy collection of four new songs.

For fans of The Movielife, New Found Glory, Midt-- hell, anything from the heyday of Drive Thru Records!

options.name: Set of White and Clear Green (While Quantities Last)

name: The Codas - Dead Radio
description: New EP from the quartet formerly known as Night Torn Mad features a slick new sound. With a much tighter focus on production and shaping a cohesive release, Dead Radio marks a huge departure for principal song-writer Kris King, who is once again joined by bassist Aaron Williams, guitarist Matt Thomasson (who now dabbles in keys) and drummer Jeremy Heyer.

name: On My Honor- The Good, The Bad and the Getting By (LIMITED QUANTITIES)
description: Before joining the Little Heart Records family, On My Honor put out this self-produced full length. Featuring many fan favorites the record will soon be going out of print. We (and the band) are putting up the last few in stock at a discount! This record is one of the reasons we signed them! You should DEFINITELY check it out. Extremely Limited Quantities

name: Receivers- Two Years
description: Receiver's debut EP features 6 new songs including "Keep Me Close" and the cover of The Movielife's "This Time Next Year!" Also includes other bonus tracks! BACK IN STOCK! REPLACEMENT DISCS HAVE ARRIVED. IF YOU HAVE A DEFECTIVE DISC, PLEASE CONTACT puckett@littleheartrecords.com AND WE'LL REPLACE IT FREE OF CHARGE!

name: Skyscraper Stereo- Homebois in Outer Space
description: The Little Heart Records' debut album from Skyscraper Stereo.

name: Uh-Huh Baby Yeah!- Till Death Do Us Party
description: Recorded with Joe Costable (Innerpartysystem, Neon Trees) at The No Exceptions Room, Uh-Huh Baby Yeah!'s highly anticipated full length features 12 songs, including the single "Sweet Summer" and a guest appearance by Little Heart Records labelmate Danielle Bouchard on the track "My Oxygen."

name: The Gravetones- On the Edge of Madness
description: The Little Heart Records debut of Chicago's The Gravetones is mix of rock, low haunting vocals and the macabre. Recorded and Mixed by Dan Precision of Bombshelter Studios. Featuring the single "Still Screaming".

name: California- So What If This Is Temporary
description:
The six song debut EP from Little Heart Records pop punk outfit California. Featuring the songs "A Year From Now," "You and Me Or Nothing Else," and "Fortune Teller." This is honest, emo influenced pop punk for fans of The Movielife, Texas Is The Reason, Hot Water Music, and Fairweather.

ALSO AVAILABLE on VINYL 7 Inch. Vinyl edition only includes four songs, the three listed above and I Like Being a Pessimist and includes a digital download of the tracks. These were produced by Finish What You Started Records and sold via Little Heart Records under an agreement between the two parties. Very few in stock.

name: Rock N Roll Television/The FabHabs- We Share Everything
description: A split album from two of our favorite Canadian bands features new material from both acts!

name: The Royal Tees- Freak Show Alley
description: The Royal Tees are one of those hard working bands you just find yourself rooting for. Heck! Puckett of Little Heart Records wasn't even sure at first he was gonna sign them... until he realized he thought way too much about The Tees and found the songs in his head way too often. Harkening back to old school punk with a mix of rockabilly and pop-sensibility The Royal Tees plan to rock your hometown soon.

name: Aesthetics Versus Architecture- Revisions
description: This debut EP from Little Heart Records features 6 intense tracks produced by Jordan Haynes (Artifex Pereo).

name: Bush League- Discography
description: Back in Print! Bush League's entire discography of songs before their 2010 reformation has been available digitally via Little Heart Records for some time now, but it's time to restore the collection to a physical format- as the band originally intended! Supplies will be limited and there is no guarantee of a second pressing!

name: Night Torn Mad- 1.21
description: Debut full length from Night Torn Mad features 10 album cuts and a bonus track. Features the single "Escape from Mars." This is the original release from the band now known as The Codas.

name: pucknation dot com: The Album (featuring Bottom Line, Good Clean Fun and more!)
description:
Originally released by Aggravated Music in 2001, this compilation was designed to garner exposure for under appreciated bands. All profits to the record label on this release are being donated to charity; The Juvenile Diabetes Resource Organization.

1  	Intro -Intro  	  
2 	Amazing Transparent Man -Edit/undo 	
3 	Pettit Project -When Scott Got Dumped 	  
4 	Running Late -Absent 	  
5 	Pain -Gavin 	  
6 	Veeda -TV 	  
7 	Scrubs -4:30 Am 	 
8 	Fastlane -A Million Battles Lost 	  
9 	Nowhere Fast -A Thousand Miles 		
10 	Go Real Slow -Asleep With Claire 	  
11 	All Ages -One Flag, One Stone, One Memory 	
12 	Last Ride Out -Reflections 	  
13 	Dekker -Britney Spears 		
14 	Scarmongo -Lung Boat 	  	
15 	Dean Malenkos -Husband's Money 	  
16 	Huxtables -The Huxtable's Theme Song 	  
17 	Blindsided -So Glad 	  
18 	Skam Impaired -Why Regulate Radio? 	  	
19 	Fonzarellies -What In The World 	 
20 	Bottom Line -Happy Ending 	  
21 	Foursome -Intoxicated 	  
22 	52 -Lead Or Follow 	 
23 	Summer66 -Disco Man 	  	
24 	Roscoe -Surfers Pollute The Ocean 	  
25 	Last Laugh -For The Record 	  
26 	Good Clean Fun -Loser Dot Com 	  
27 	Sewing With Nancie -Gangsta's Paradise
28 	Outro -Outro

name: pucknation dot com: The Album II (feat. Stretch Arm Strong, Big D, Valencia and more!)
description:
Little Heart Records and pucknation dot com release their second compilation to benefit Women for Women International with pucknation dot com: The Album II. Featuring music from Stretch Arm Strong, Valencia, Lost City Angels, Big D And The Kids Table, The Talk, Bottom Line, Curt Phillips, Nixon and many more. All Profits Little Heart Records receives from this release will go to Women for Women International.


1  	Bottom Line - Nothing Is Real (as If It Ever Was)  	  
2 	Rudiger - 2000 Light Years Away 	  
3 	Valencia - Que Sera Sera 		
4 	Nowhere Fast - Anniversary For A Tuesday 
5 	Phenomenauts - Mission 	
6 	Talk - Imaginary Lines 	  
7 	Friday's Gone - Welcome To The Land Of Unamerica (we Are Watching You) 	
8 	Curt Phillips - Bring Me Back 	 
9 	Mint6ten - Sweet Embrace 	 
10 	Redhanded - Down The Middle 	  
11 	Big D And The Kids Table - You Lose, You're Crazy 		
12 	Stretch Arm Strong - Hearts On 
13 	Whatswithwillard? - Edge Of Forever 	 
14 	Ganthet - Rise Above 	  
15 	Uncle Pervey - All I've Got 	 
16 	When Sparks Fly - Finding The Weapons Of Self-destruction 	 
17 	Your Ex Hero - When Life Imitates Art 	 
18 	Sunday Mail - Hey Maude 	  
19 	Tastyface - Ugly Sidewalks 	 
20 	Nixon - Therapissed 	
21 	Satori In Paris - Die Die My Darling 	  	
22 	Fingers Cut Megamachine - Testament 		
23 	Jamili Brown - Blackbird 	  	
24 	Lost City Angels - Hardly Seems 		
25 	Merediths - Dream A Little Dream

name: Last Minute Letter- Don't Speak So Soon CLEARANCE!!
description: The debut Little Heart Records' EP from Albany, New York's Last Minute Letter. Features the songs "Climbing Higher" and "Sunsets."

name: The Uprising- The Other America CLEARANCE!!
description:
The 12-song Little Heart Records debut album from The Uprising is a blend of Rock, Folk and Americana unlike any you've ever heard before. Intricate songwriting and thought out lyrics looking for a positive outcome result in a political movement based on solutions-- not negativity-- something rare in the music industry today.

NEW LOWER PRICE!
Late last year, Adam Renner, one of the principle song writers on this project, passed away. 

We are reducing the price on this item for two reasons- 
A) because I feel guilty profiting off someone who has passed away and general interest in this record has gone up and 
B) to encourage those to buy it and share in the experience of this talented songwriter's work. At this point, we're just on a track to break even. 

Adam loved sharing music and experiences with others, and this felt like the best way to honor that.

name: Nowhere Fast - Hollow Angel  CLEARANCE!!
description:
The Little Heart Records debut of Louisville's Nowhere Fast features the band's signature sound on 4 tracks. 

"Nowhere Fast will give AFI, Strung Out, Face to Face, Enemy You, Slick Shoes- the whole melodies movement a good run for their money..." -Punk and Oi in the UK

name: Little Heart Records Pull-Over Hoodie: Hedgehog
description: That's his bellybutton. Swear. Designed by Matt Haas of Animal Hair Museum! Also available as a Tee here! Cotton Blend/Robin's Egg Blue

name: Little Heart Records Pull-Over Hoodie: Tiger
description:
The second best thing on earth with stripes on it. (First? Hint: Fruit Stripe Gum.)

Cotton Blend/Black

name: Little Heart Records Hooded Zip-Up: We Are Music
description:
Yeah, we know, that big list of genres on the back has a few we haven't actually done a release for. We're getting to them. Consider it more of a checklist.

Cotton Blend/Black, Red or Chocolate

name: Little Heart Records Tank: Bull in a Record Shop
description:
For the consumer looking to wear Little Heart Records stuff and still look like a badass.

Wait, what does that say about us?

Oops.

Cotton Blend/Black

name: Little Heart Records T-Shirt: Li'l Big Boy's Heart
description:
The only way this Big Boy homage could get any better is tartar sauce.

Cotton Blend/Red or White

name: Fast Friends T-Shirt: Stand By Your Manatee
description: You should always show support for local music and local manatees. This shirt knocks out two birds with one stone.

name: Skyscraper Stereo T-Shirt: Chili Dawg!
description:
There's actually a funny story behind this. The guys actually had this shirt design before Little Heart ever became involved. Somehow that initial stock ended up in Mr. Goodbar's trunk. We're talking about new shirt ideas and someone brings it up. We go outside and it was like that scene in Indiana Jones where he lines up the scepter with the lens with a window and the little beam of light cast down on it. Then we had a bunch more made, y'know, because those had been in a trunk for so long. Now it's a best seller.

Cotton Blend/White or Black

name: Begging Victoria T-Shirt: Ketchup 57
description:
Americans put ketchup on everything else. Why not band t-shirts?

cotton blend/red

name: Running on E T-Shirt: That Dinosaur with the Chainsaw is Sketchy
description: It's a dinosaur. With a chainsaw. You need it. This version the art has sketchy linework. You kids want smooth art? Click on the other one! Cotton Blend/White

name: Running on E T-Shirt: That Dinosaur with the Chainsaw is Smooth
description: It's a dinosaur. With a chainsaw. You need it. This version the art has smooth linework. You kids want sketchy art? Click on the other one! Cotton Blend/Kelly Green

name: Little Heart Records T-Shirt: Hedgehog
description: That's his bellybutton. Swear. Designed by Matt Haas of Animal Hair Museum! Also available as a Hoodie here! Cotton Blend/Robin's Egg Blue

name: Aim For The Skies T-Shirt: 2012 Couch Burning Champions
description:
We're from Kentucky. We know a thing or two about setting sofas on fire.

cotton blend/wildcat blue

name: Running on E T-Shirt: Link is Getting Tired
description:
If you don't get the reference, I'm sorry, you're too young and we cannot date.

Cotton Blend/Black

name: Your Favorite Hero T-Shirt: Empire
description:
Along time ago in a galaxy far, far aw-- wait, aren't all galaxies far, far away? Given how much space one takes up in the first place?

Cotton Blend/Navy Blue

name: Aim For The Skies T-Shirt: Molly Goes To College
description:
Milo isn't the only one getting an education.


cotton blend/black

name: Mercy Academy T-shirt: Fortune Teller
description:
Guaranteed to predict the future. And by "guaranteed" we mean "completely unable."

Cotton Blend/Black

name: Little Heart Records T-Shirt: Tiger
description:
It's the eye of the tiger and the something, something, something.

Cotton/Black

name: Little Heart Records T-Shirt: FREE PUCKETT
description:
Sometimes, dumb things happen. This shirt is because... again... sometimes dumb things happen.

Cotton Blend/White

name: Late Ones T-Shirt: Drink Up
description:
One time a guy saw me wearing this and did a double take because he thought it was an Ale-8 tee. I pointed out it was for the band and that he should check them out. He then proceeded to tell me Ale-8 was his favorite drink, 6 different ways, for the next 40 minutes. That is not an isolated incident.

Cotton Blend/Green or Black

name: Your Favorite Hero T-Shirt: Up The Punx
description:
More T-Shirts should have pictures of people drinking on them.

Cotton Blend/Black

name: Little Heart Records T-Shirt: Hearts Are Never Bulletproof
description: This is our logo, designed by Bradley Shellito of Vega Under Fire. Long ago I promised him we would plug the fact he designed our logo. This is that plug. Cotton Blend/Yellow or Black

name: Think Harder T-Shirt: Brain Boner
description:
The infamous shirt about a brain and it's erection. If you don't get the joke, think hard.

Cotton Blend/Black

name: Little Heart Records T-Shirt: Suicide Rocker
description:
Once, at a fest, we had a table up with this picture on the banner. A ton of kids came up to check us out because of it. They all wanted to buy it on a shirt. Somehow, only the youth sizes got packed. Kids tried it on anyway. Nothing funnier than a XL metal kid with an epic beard trying on a youth medium T-Shirt. Now, once again (and forever) available in adult sizes.

Cotton blend/Navy Blue or Kelly Green

name: Joey Blue T-Shirt: Martini
description:
Love should be shaken, not stirred. Or something. Unless you love your baby. Never shake a baby.

Cotton/Blue or Black

name: Little Heart Records T-Shirt: Sad, Sad Robots
description:
My mom calls this 'that alien shirt.' I die a little every time.

Cotton Blend/Black

name: Think Harder T-Shirt: Louisville Metro Pop-Punk
description:
You can't change me. Better people have tried. 

Cotton Blend/Navy Blue

name: Aim For The Skies T-Shirt: False Metal
description:
There is nothing worse than a poser.

Cotton/Black

name: Common Collective T-Shirt: Truthiness
description:
This shirt makes me think of Charlie Brown even though it really lacks much similarity to the character.

Cotton Blend/Yellow

name: Mercy Academy T-shirt: Fox
description:
This one is printed on a Tultex tee with a tear away tag... so you can never sell it to a consignment store. You are ours... forever. 
...but why would you get rid of it. It's adorable.

Cotton Blend/Black

name: Skyscraper Stereo T-Shirt: City Speakers (Avail. in Mens and Juniors)
description:
When you do hoodrat things with your friends, we recommend this T-Shirt. That way if you get caught, we get a nod in Crime Times. 

Cotton Blend/Red or Charcoal
Juniors cut in Pink or Purple- $15.00

name: Catfight Baseball Tee: Scratches
description:
This is the very first Little Heart Records Baseball Tee. Own a piece of history.

Cotton Blend/White with Black Sleeves

name: Little Heart Records Undies: Vaginaraptor Strikes!
description:
We know he looks more like a dilophosaurus. There just weren't any terrible puns to do with that dinosaur name. Vaginaraptor is so catchy.

Cotton/Black

name: Mercy Academy Tote Bag: For the Birds
description: Now you have somewhere to hold your books. Or if you're my mom, delicious Wether's Originals candies.

name: Uh-Huh Baby Yeah! Tank: 2012 Logo (Avail in Juniors) CLEARANCE!!
description:
No sleeves for those who feel restricted.


Juniors cut in White

name: Uh-Huh Baby Yeah! T-Shirt: Relax CLEARANCE!!
description:
Frankie says so.

Cotton/Red, Yellow or Black with Gold Foil

options.name: Sky Blue with Sea Green/Extra Large

name: Uh-Huh Baby Yeah! T-Shirt: Uh-Huh Bacon Yeah! CLEARANCE!!
description:
In honor of Kevin Fletcher's well-publicized tattoo (who didn't see that on TV or on-line, right?) we had this shirt designed for bacon lovers.

Cotton Blend/Black
or
Cotton Blend/Navy Blue

name: Uh-Huh Baby Yeah! T-Shirt: Spring Break! CLEARANCE!!
description:
As seen in the movie Thor. Okay, that's a lie.

Cotton Blend/Grape

name: Uh-Huh Baby Yeah! Undies: Till Death Do Us Party Boy Shorts CLEARANCE!!
description:
Underwear for ladies. An inevitability when the band's name is Uh-Huh Baby Yeah!

Pink
